comments:
When try to execute IAC with JDK 1.5.0_02, we get the following error:

Executing service synchronously:
org.eclipse.hyades.ui.connector
{mutableNode=org.eclipse.hyades.execution.core.util.MutableObject@d90727, 
port=10002, host=localhost, showErrors=true}
Exception in thread "Object Reader Thread: Direct connection: 0" 
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java/lang/Win32Process
     at 
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.impl.PlatformUtility.getProcessIDO
(Native Method)
    at 
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.impl.PlatformUtility.launchProcess
(PlatformUtility.java:69)
   at 
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.hyades.impl.HyadesMessageProcessorImp
l.handleLaunchProcess(HyadesMessageProcessorImpl.java:639)
  at 
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.hyades.impl.HyadesMessageProcessorImp
l.incommingCommand(HyadesMessageProcessorImpl.java:145)
  at 
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.hyades.impl.HyadesMessageProcessorImp
l.incommingMessage(HyadesMessageProcessorImpl.java:107)
  at 
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.hyades.impl.HyadesMessageProcessorImp
l.incommingObject(HyadesMessageProcessorImpl.java:74)
  at 
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.impl.TrafficControllerImpl$ObjectRead
erThread.run(TrafficControllerImpl.java:258)

We will look at this in 4.2.
Looks like the class java/lang/Win32Process is not in JDK 1.5 anymore

Created an attachment (id=29331)
Patch file

Fix in hand for JDK 1.5 support.
Fix reviewed and checked in 2005/11/04 14:11 EST
